Description: Rim sherd of Attic red-figured pottery type B cup; interior glazed black; exterior: reserved band at top of rim; below, red-figure decoration consisting of Hermes rushing to left, holding kerykeion (only shaft remaining) in his lowered left hand; wears petasos and short girt chiton.
Bibliographic references: Vase / Catalogue of Vases in the British Museum (E134.1)
Venit 1982 / Painted Pottery from the Greek Mainland found in Egypt, 640-450 BC (p. 510, no. C75)
Villing et al 2013-2015 / Naukratis: Greeks in Egypt (GA.0650) (Phase 1)
